com.aeonium.javafx.actions

Class FXAbstractAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.concurrent.Service
      • com.aeonium.javafx.actions.FXAbstractAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.concurrent.Worker, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public abstract class FXAbstractAction
extends javafx.concurrent.Service
    The abstract base class for all aeFXAction actions. The abstract action is a service. Thus, it uses tasks for encapsulating the action logic. You can use this base class in two different ways:
    1. The first, convenient way is to implement your action logic in the onAction() method. This is suitable for simple actions that will not take much time - and thus will not need progress tracking.
    2. If your action needs progress tracking and a more sophisticated task logic, then you better implement your custom onCreateTask factory method.
    Author:
    robert rohm

    • Method Detail

      • createTask

        protected javafx.concurrent.Task createTask()
        Default implementation: create a new Task from the Service and put the task into the manager's current tasks list. The default task invokes the onAction method of the action imlementation. This method also checks if your action implements the onCreateTask method in order to create a custom task implementation.
        Specified by:
        createTask in class javafx.concurrent.Service
        Returns:
        The tast to be executed by the service.

      • onAction

        protected void onAction(javafx.event.Event event)
        This is a convenience method where you can place your action logic if you do not need to update task progress etc.
        Parameters:
        event - The event that triggered the action.

      • onCreateTask

        protected javafx.concurrent.Task onCreateTask()
        Override this method in order to create your own task implementation - in this case you may leave the onAction Method empty.
        Returns:
        The task to be executed by the service

        Returns:

      • setTooltip

        public void setTooltip(javafx.scene.control.Tooltip value)
        Set the optional tooltip for the action. Controls using the action will be bound to this tooltip where applicable.

        Attention! Since the tooltip modifies the sceene graph, this method may have to be invoked on the JavaFX application thread.

        Parameters:
        value - The tooltip object.

        The tooltip property or null if not assigned.
